strings.string: Press OK to apply the change
Change your digital satellite receiver settings
Setup your digital satellite receiver including antenna, channel search, update, etc
Display the programme information of each channel in time and date order
Display a list of your TV/radio channels
Manage and view your multimedia content in one place
Display device information including system versions, free disk space, etc
Learn how to get the most out of PRISMCUBE RUBY
Get current weather and weather forecast for thousands of cities around the world
Access your picture collection and view them as a slideshow with transition effects
Playback videos from the beginning or resume viewing from the moment you stopped
Browse through your source folders and play music files
Run your installed add-ons which enhance the features and functions of XBMC
Configure the general settings of XBMC
Handle your multimedia files in an easy and efficient way
Display detailed information about your system status
Check your PRISMCUBE RUBY info at a glance
Access your favorite XBMC add-ons in a convenient way
Take the following steps for getting your PRISMCUBE RUBY ready for use
Select the cable connection type on your STB and configure DiSEqC setup
Perform a quick and easy automatic channel scan or search channels manually
Add new transponders or edit the transponders already exist
Configure the general settings for your digital satellite receiver
Setup Smartcard or CI-Module configuration for watching pay channels
Get the latest updates on your PRISMCUBE RUBY
If the problem continues, force repository refresh
( SYSTEM > Add-ons > Get Add-ons > Press i button > Force refresh )
The Timer displays the list of all your timer recordings
Installing unverified addons may slow your box down
Press the left button on the remote to set focus to OK / Cancel
Apply Instant Zapping in Channel List
Show Clock on Front Panel Display
Show Extend EPG in Channel List
To fix an empty repository or any other problems, try Force refresh in the context menu
Otherwise it will restore after few seconds
Please select other OSD language to type different characters
Please press %s button to change keyboard language
Set Current Position for East Limit
Set Current Position for West Limit
only available when Video plays in fullscreen
Please try again after stopping the recordings
Please try again after deleting your timers first
Recording stopped due to insufficient disk space
Do you want to change the channel %s minutes later?
The channel will be changed %s min later
Your system will reboot in %s seconds
To watch PIP, please switch from radio mode to TV mode
Unable to tune the channel on PIP
Start automatic power down after %s sec
Select HDMI or Analog for your video output
Sorry, that's an irrelevant transponder frequency
Could not read script from file
Do you want to save changes?
A timer name must be at least %d characters long
Are you sure you want to remove%s all your bookmarks?
The path could not be mounted
Could not add this record path
Do you want to delete this record path?
The time you entered has already passed
Select Data To Be Backup ( Optional )
Assign a static IP address for wireless network
Connect to a hidden wireless network
Enter a network name for the wireless network you wish to connect to
Select security type for the hidden wireless network
Press [BACK] on the remote to close channel search dialog
Are you sure you want to stop the channel scan?
You have reached the maximum number of%s bookmarks allowed
When set to 'Separated', the tuner 2 receives its own signal input
however it will receive only the channel level currently being received by the tuner 1 when this is set to 'Loopthrough'
When set to 'Same with Tuner 1', both tuners are connected to the same signal source
Select a control method for tuner 1
You can add, delete or configure satellites here
Select a control method for tuner 2
Please reset your device to factory settings
Go to the configuration menu now?
When you perform a factory reset,%s all your settings revert to factory defaults
Do you want to save changes before exit?
Are you sure you want to quit the first installation?
Try again after completing firmware update
please wait after pressing OK button
Select the language you want the menu to be in
Select the language that you wish to listen to
Go to the video and audio setup page
Select the display format for TV screen
When set to 'On', Dolby Digital audio will be selected automatically when broadcast
Go back to the language setup page
Go to the antenna and satellite setup page
Go back to the video and audio setup page
Go to the satellite configuration page
Do you want to perform a channel search in the first installation?
Select the satellite on which the transponder you wish to scan is located
Select or enter the transponder frequency for the selected satellite
Select the Digital Video Broadcasting type for the selected satellite
Select the error control mode of data transmission for the selected satellite
Select the direction of the electrical and magnetic fields of signals for the satellite above
Set the amount of data, that is transmitted per second in the data stream
If you set to 'On', both the existing transponders and additional transponders that have not yet been stored to be located are scanned for new channels
When set to 'Off', only the factory default transponders of the satellites you previously selected will be scanned for new channels.
Select whether you wish to scan free and scrambled, free only or scrambled only
Go back to the antenna and satellite setup page
Go to the time and date setup page
Select a provider you want to scan channels from
Go back to the channel search setup page
When set to 'Automatic', the time will be obtained by the receiver automatically from a specific channel that you select
Select a channel you want to set your time and date by
Set the time zone that will be the basis for the date and time display
When set to 'Automatic', the system automatically change over to and from summer and winter time
Press OK button to save time settings
Go to the summary page of first installation
Go back to the time and date setup page
Scanning multiple satellites at the same time%s cannot be done in manual channel search
No configured satellite or transponder available
No time info was given by that channel
Same name of satellite already exists
Select the desired satellite whose signal is to be received by the tuner
Select the LNB type used in your digital satellite system
Select the LNB frequency to the LNB you are using
When set to 'On', LNBs will be switched between low and high band
When set to 'On', DiSEqC repeats its command
Set one of the pre-defined transponder frequency and symbol rate to get the best signal strength and quality in order to confirm that your settings are correct
Select the transponder frequency range for channel search
Press OK button to start a channel search
Are you sure you want to remove%s this transponder?
Installing and executing XBMC add-ons%s may not work properly without an internal HDD
No channels available for the selected mode
You have reached the maximum number of%s recordings allowed
Try again after stopping all your recordings first

Are you sure you want to remove%s all channels from this favorite group?
Could not find any results for that search
Enter a number to insert after
Are you sure you want to remove%s%s?
Skipping all channels is not allowed
Are you sure you want to delete the channels%s including currently recording or reserved?
Add Channels to This Favorite Group
A keyword must be at least %d characters long
Please set a different value for each tuner
When set to 'On', your UniCable system allows the transmission frequency to be protected by entering a PIN code
Select an available transmission channel from SCR 0 to SCR 7 for tuner %d
Enter a PIN code for tuner %d
Go back to the previous satellite configuration page
Go to the next satellite configuration page
Select an available transmission channel from SCR 0 to SCR 7 for tuner 1
Enter a PIN code for tuner 1
Select an available transmission channel from SCR 0 to SCR 7 for tuner 2
Enter a PIN code for tuner 2
Do you want to repair database? (%s)
The PIN code must be 4-digit long
Sorry, that PIN code does not match
Select a tuner you want to search
Display user presentation of service numbers in a familiar form or sequentially
You can customise the appearance of PRISMCUBE RUBY
WARNING : Problems may arise from using experimental features and there is no guarantee that your system will stay usable
Control PRISMCUBE using your existing TV remote when connected via HDMI
Receive information from the RSS server as soon as it is updated
Allows you to display clock on the top middle of live screen
Allows you to display clock on front panel display instead of channel name and menu
Allows you to display next EPG notification on live screen
Watch live stream of TV channels from PC or mobile devices
Allows you to playback 1080 24p video without having to switch the video output manually
Set an action for STB when turning TV on via HDMI-CEC
Set an action for STB when turning TV off via HDMI-CEC
Set an action for TV when turning STB on via HDMI-CEC
Set an action for TV when turning STB off via HDMI-CEC
You can only have 4 satellites for DiSEqC 1.0
You can only have 1 satellite for Simple LNB
Press Next button to setup satellites
Go to the Channel Search page
Add a new satellite to your satellite list
Delete a satellite from your list
Are you sure you want to remove this timer?
Are you sure you want to remove all your timers?
When set to 'On', the system will descramble up to 2 scrambled channels on same transponder simultaneously
You can control the movements of the motorized antenna here
Up/Down = Zoom in/out ( Current rate : %s ) %sLeft/Right = Previous/Next step
You have reached the maximum rate
You have reached the minimum rate
Try again after stopping playback%s and timeshift
Are you sure you want to delete this file?
Are you sure you want to delete%s all your recorded files?
A filename must be at least %d characters long
Change your PRISMCUBE RUBY language preferences
Set limits on your kids' digital satellite receiver use
Set the system's digital audio output settings
Setup the output settings for TVs that support HDMI cable
Adjust settings related to the system's date and time
Delete everything off your hard drive
Restore your system to factory settings
Change additional settings for PRISMCUBE RUBY
Sorry, that's an incorrect PIN code
Your PIN code has been changed successfully
All channels and configuration settings%s including antenna will be lost
All your XBMC addons and userdata will be lost
Try again after stopping your playback
Formatting media partition%s cannot be undone!
Formatting recording partition%s cannot be undone!
Everything on your hard drive will be erased
Could not find a hard drive
Select the language for the subtitle to be in
Select the language for the secondary subtitle to be in
Enter your PIN code to change the parental settings
Set a restriction for the main menu
Set an access restriction to chosen channels
When set to 'On', your PRISMCUBE RUBY automatically start a timeshift recording when a different channel is selected
Select the preferred size of timeshift buffer
Select recording duration for a channel that has no EPG info
Set the pre-recording time for a EPG channel
Set the post-recording time for a EPG channel
Add or remove a record storage location
Select a directory where the recorded files will be stored
Select a delay time for audio
Set RGB or YUV for HDMI color space
Set aspect ratio of your TV
Set picture format according to TV aspect ratio
Select Ethernet or wireless for your network connection
Press OK button to setup wireless network manually
When set to 'DHCP', your IP address will be automatically allocated by the DHCP server
Press OK button to save the IP address settings
When set to 'Automatic', the time and date will be obtained automatically from the channel that you select
When set to 'Automatic', the system automatically change over to summer time
When set to 'On', the system automatically start to collect EPG data
Adjust EPG scan interval for each channel
Select which channels to grab EPG data from
Set a starting time for EPG grabber
Select the channels for which you want to grab EPG data
Select a favorite group for EPG grabbing
Press OK button to remove everything in the media partition
Press OK button to remove everything in the recording partition
Press OK button to erase your hard disk drive
Restore all settings and data to factory default (excluding XBMC)
Delete all your XBMC addons and settings
When set to 'On', the system switches to deep standby mode if you press 'Standby' button to help reduce the amount of electricity used
Set the time for switching into standby mode when not being used
Adjust the fan speed level for your system
Set the time for the channel info to be displayed when zapping
Set the time for the playback info to be displayed on the screen
When set to 'On', the hard drive is turned off when the system goes into active standby mode
Adjust notification frequency for firmware update
The password must be between 8 and 64 characters
To backup your user data and XBMC add-ons,%s insert a USB flash memory
Start formatting without making a backup?

Please insert a USB flash memory

Enter Media Partition Size in GB
